patches.summary: Reversed word order, שבעים repeated with different function, Hebrew would say 69 if that's what was meant, and 490 years (not 483) lands precisely at Messiah. H8147 means 'twofold, again' — the decree done a second time.

find.kjv: shall be seven{H7651} weeks{H7620}, and threescore{H8346} and two{H8147} weeks{H7620}:
find.akjv: shall be seven{H7651} weeks{H7620}, and three score{H8346} and two{H8147} weeks{H7620}:
find.asv: shall be seven{H7651} weeks{H7620}, and threescore{H8346} and two{H8147} weeks{H7620}:
find.dbt: shall be seven weeks, and sixty-two weeks.
find.drb: shall be seven weeks, and sixty-two weeks:
find.jps: shall be seven weeks, and threescore and two weeks;
find.slt: shall be seven weeks, and sixty and two weeks.
find.wbt: shall be seven weeks, and sixty and two weeks:
find.ylt: are weeks seven, and weeks sixty and two

replace.kjv: seventy{H7651} sevened{H7620} (70×7). Then jubilee{H8346} sixty{H8147} and again{H7620} (a second time):
replace.akjv: seventy{H7651} sevened{H7620} (70×7). Then jubilee{H8346} sixty{H8147} and again{H7620} (a second time):
replace.asv: seventy{H7651} sevened{H7620} (70×7). Then jubilee{H8346} sixty{H8147} and again{H7620} (a second time):
replace.dbt: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time).
replace.drb: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time):
replace.jps: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time);
replace.slt: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time).
replace.wbt: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time):
replace.ylt: seventy sevened (70×7). Then jubilee sixty and again (a second time)

patches.summary: תשוב is a separate verb 'they will return' — not part of 'built again.' חרוץ (H2742) means moat/trench, not wall. העתים has the definite article — the times, not just any times.

find.kjv: the street{H7339} shall be built{H1129}{(H8738)} again{H7725}{(H8799)}, and the wall{H2742}, even in troublous{H6695} times{H6256}.
find.akjv: the street{H7339} shall be built{H1129} again{H7725}, and the wall{H2742}, even in troublous{H6695} times{H6256}.
find.asv: it shall be built{H1129} again{H7725}, with street{H7339} and moat{H2742}, even in troublous{H6695} times{H6256}.
find.dbt: the street shall be built again, and the moat, even in troublous times.
find.drb: the street shall be built again, and the walls, even in straitness of times.
find.jps: it shall be built again, with broad place and moat, but in troublous times.
find.slt: it shall be built again with street and trench, even in the narrow of times.
find.wbt: the street shall be built again, and the wall, even in troublous times.
find.ylt: turned back and built hath been a broad place, and switch, even in the distress of the times

replace.kjv: they will return{H7725}, and it will be built{H1129}: the plaza{H7339} and the moat{H2742}. Then in tribulation{H6695}, the (end) times{H6256}.
replace.akjv: they will return{H7725}, and it will be built{H1129}: the plaza{H7339} and the moat{H2742}. Then in tribulation{H6695}, the (end) times{H6256}.

replace.dbt: they will return, and it will be built: the plaza and the moat. Then in tribulation, the times.

replace.slt: they will return, and it will be built: the plaza and the moat. Then in tribulation, the times.
replace.wbt: they will return, and it will be built: the plaza and the moat. Then in tribulation, the times.
replace.ylt: they will return, and it will be built: the plaza and the moat. Then in tribulation, the times

patches.summary: Same pattern as v25: definite article הַ on שבעים points back to the jubilee system of v24 — not a generic 'weeks.' H8147 means 'twofold, again' per Strong's.

find.asv: And after{H310} the threescore{H8346} and two{H8147} weeks{H7620}
find.jps: And after the threescore and two weeks
find.slt: And after sixty and two weeks,
find.wbt: And after sixty and two weeks
find.ylt: And after the sixty and two weeks,

replace.ylt: And after the jubilee sixty and second (twofold) [orders followed by 70×7]

patches.summary: Consonantal כרת is the standard covenant verb — 'cut a covenant,' not 'be cut off.' אין means 'vanish,' as with Enoch: 'he was not, for God took him' (Gen 5:24).

find.kjv: shall Messiah{H4899} be cut off{H3772}{(H8735)}, but not for himself: and
find.akjv: shall Messiah{H4899} be cut off{H3772}, but not for himself: and
find.asv: shall the anointed{H4899} one be cut off,{H3772} and shall have nothing: and
find.dbt: shall Messiah be cut off, and shall have nothing; and
find.drb: Christ shall be slain: and the people that shall deny him shall not be his. And
find.jps: shall an anointed one be cut off, and be no more; and
find.slt: Messiah shall be cut off, and not for him: and
find.wbt: shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and
find.ylt: cut off is Messiah, and the city and the holy place are not his, the Leader who hath come doth destroy the people

patches.summary: Hebrew עיר (city) derives from 'to be watchful' — a watchful people. והקדש can be read as both 'the holy' (noun) and 'he will sanctify them' (verb). The singular verb ישחית means 'he will destroy,' not 'they.'

find.kjv: the people{H5971} of the prince{H5057} that shall come{H935}{(H8802)} shall destroy{H7843}{(H8686)} the city{H5892} and the sanctuary{H6944}
find.akjv: the people{H5971} of the prince{H5057} that shall come{H935} shall destroy{H7843} the city{H5892} and the sanctuary{H6944}
find.asv: the people{H5971} of the prince{H5057} that shall come{H935} shall destroy{H7843} the city{H5892} and the sanctuary;{H6944}
find.dbt: the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary
find.drb: a people with their leader that shall come, shall destroy the city and the sanctuary
find.jps: the people of a prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary
find.slt: the people of the leader coming shall destroy the city and the holy place
find.wbt: the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary

patches.summary: The consonants שבעים appear twice identically — only vowel points distinguish 'weeks' from 'seventy.' Smith's Literal independently reads 'Seventy seventy.'
